suggestions: Consult your physician to investigate the cause of your low platelet count.
Report any unusual bleeding or bruising to your doctor immediately.
Seek urgent consultation with a hematologist to interpret the complex and contradictory red blood cell findings (low RBC, low MCV, high Hemoglobin, high MCHC).
Repeat a complete blood count (CBC) to verify results and rule out potential technical issues or sample artifacts.
Further specific tests (e.g., iron studies, peripheral blood smear) will likely be needed to clarify the underlying diagnosis for the red blood cell abnormalities.
Discuss with your doctor about dietary changes, such as reducing intake of sugars and unhealthy fats, to help manage triglyceride levels.
Incorporate regular physical activity into your routine to support healthy lipid levels.
